title: Ancient Vietnamese village opens doors for tourists to explore Lunar New Year customs
description: HANOI, Feb. 12 (Xinhua) -- Carefully wrapping fresh ingredients inside thin rice paper, Do Thi Minh Nguyet instructs foreign visitors on how to make spring rolls inside her centuries-old home in Hanoi's Duong Lam ancient village as the festive season approaches.Amid laughter, sizzling pans and the aroma of fresh herbs, the simple cooking class offers tourists an intimate glimpse into a traditional Lunar New Year

title: In the Pecos Canyonlands, Discovering the Daily Lives of Ancient Mural Makers
description: The Lower Pecos Canyonlands – where the Pecos and Devils rivers join the Rio Grande – contain globally significant rock art. But these same shallow caves have preserved much else from prehistory: bits of tools and textiles, plant and animal remains.

title: Tamil Graffiti In Egyptian Tomb: How Ancient Indian Merchants Became Tourists In Land Of Pharaohs
description: The presence of Tamil-Brahmi deep in the Nile Valley—far from the maritime hubs—provides concrete proof of a sophisticated 'Indian Diaspora' in the first and second centuries CE
